intro: Gethyllis ciliaris subsp. longituba, commonly known as the long-tubed starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated floral tubes, which are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. It typically grows in grassy areas and has a low, spreading growth habit. The plant is often found in regions with well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
